question: Drug of choice for Falciparum Malaria is:-
exp: DOC for Falciparum Malaria - ACT. ( Aemisinin based Combination therapy ) In Noh Eastern states:- ACT-AL co-formulated tablet of Aemether-20 mg / Lumefantrine - 120 mg. Primaquine 0. 75 mg/ kg Body weight on day 2. 2. In Other States:- ACT-SP -Aesunate 50 mg tablet for 3 days and Sulphadoxine (500mg) - Pyremethamine (25mg) tablets for 1 Day. Primaquine tablets should be given on Day 2.
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Disease caused by virus of family of RNA paramyxovirus, with incubation period of 14-21 days with high secondary attack rate with most common complication of aseptic meningitis. Live attenuated vaccine is available for disease with strain Jery. II Lynn strain. Name of disease is?
exp: Mumps Caused by virus of family of RNA paramyxovirus Incubation period of 14-21 days Mode of transmission: Respiratory / air droplets Source of infection: Cases Period of communicability: 4-6 days before symptoms & 7days after symptoms High secondary attack rate = 86% Most common complication is aseptic meningitis; orchitis Live attenuated vaccine is available for disease, with strain Jeryll Lynn strain
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Culex mosquito is a vector for:
exp: ANOPHELES CULEX AEDES MANSONIA Boat shaped Small in clusters Single; Cigar shaped Star shaped; in clusters Rest parallel to water surface Rest at an angle to water surface Rest at an angle to water surface Attached to roots of Aquatic plants - Sits by making an angle of 45o with surface - Have straight body & spotted wings - Hunchback posture - Hunchback posture 3-5 Km 11 km 100 m Clean water. Hence known as Sophisticated mosquito Diy water - Nuisance mosquito Aificial collection of rain water. - Tiger mosquito Aquatic plants Malaria Lymphatic filariasis Japanese Encephalitis West nile fever Dengue Chikungunya Yellow fever Zika virus Rift valley fever Brugian filariasis
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Which of the following statements is true regarding Arbo-viruses?
exp: Discussing options one by one: Option-1 - False - Yellow fever is not present in India. Option-2 - True - Kyasanur forest disease is transmitted by ticks. In india: hard tick. Outside India: soft ticks. Option-3 - Flase - Aedes aegypti mosquito is the vector of dengue fever; Culex is vector of JE. Option- 4 - False - Dengue virus has four serotypes. There is no lifelong immunity against dengue.
opa: Yellow fever is endemic in India
opb: Kyasanur forest disease is transmitted by ticks
opc: Mosquito of culex visnoi complex is the vector of dengue fever
opd: Dengue virus has only one serotype
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Which dengue serotype has higher risk of causing Dengue hemorrhagic fever as Secondary infection?
exp: Secondary infection with dengue serotype 2 or multiple infection with different serotypes lead to severe form dengue DHF/DSS.
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Causative agent for 'Oriental sore' is:-
exp: Leishmania tropica causes Cutaneous leishmaniasis and Oriental Sore. Leishmania donovoni causes Visceral leishmaniasis. (Kala azar) Leishmania brazeliensis causes Muco-cutaneous leishmaniasis. Onchocerca volvulus cause Onchocerciasis. (River blindness)

exp: Fixed Viral Strain is non pathogenic & does not have negri bodies, so its safer for production for Rebies vaccine. VA ( Ankara) H1 N1 - California Mosquirix vaccine - S, S.

question: Elimination of neonatal tetanus in village, true is:
exp: NNT elimination: Classification Rate TT-2 coverage Attended deliveries NNT elimination <0. 1/1000 LB >90% >75% Tetanus: Caused by Clostridium tetani Source & reservoir: soil I. P - 6-10days Period of communicability: none Category of wound & administration of TT vaccine Category Clean wound < 6H Other wounds A- Complete course < 5yrs Nothing Nothing B- CC; 5-10yrs 1 Dose 1 Dose C- CC; > 10yrs 1 Dose 1 Dose + TIG D- No CC/ unknown Complete course Complete course + TIG
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Which of the following is NOT an indicator for Malaria surveillance in a population?
exp: Pre-Eradication Era indicators: Spleen Rate: Average Enlarged Spleen Parasite Rate Parasite Density Index Infant Parasite Index Propoional Case Rate Eradication Era indicators: Annual Parasite Incidence (API)-Best indiator of Malaria control. Annual Blood Examination Rate (ABER)-Best indicator of operational efficiency. Annual Falciparum Incidence (AFI) Slide Positivity Rate (SPR): ) good outbreak indicator. Slide Falciparum Rate (SFR) - Hence option-1 is the answer
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Toxic shock syndrome is mostly due to which vaccine?
exp: TSS occurs when Measles Vaccine is Contaminated or the same l is used for more than one session on the same day or next day. It reflects poor Quality of Immunization Services. It is totally preventable. Symptoms are severe watery diarrohoea, vomiting and high fever. Case fatality rates are high. It may cause death within 48 hrs.
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Best specimen for diagnosis of rabies in a living person is:-
exp: Best specimen for diagnosis:- Disease Preferred specimen Rabies (living person) Biopsy of skin follicles on nape of neck Rabies (dead person) Brain (Hippocampus) biopsy Rabies (living dog) Brain (hippocampus) biopsy Rabies (dead dog) Brain (hippocampus) biopsy Diphtheria Nasal swabs, Throat swabs Influenza Nasopharyngeal secretions H1. N1 influenza Nasopharyngeal secretions Tuberculosis Sputum Malaria Blood HIV/AIDS Blood
opb: Biopsy of skin follicles on neck
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: WHO declared COVID- 19 as Global pandemic on:
exp: COVID- 19: Origin- Wuhan, China 1st Dec, 2019- 1st case was repoed 1st Jan, 2020- Wuhan seafood market was closed 7th Jan, 2020- Chinese health authority identifies Novel Corona virus 30th Jan, 2020- 1st case repoed in India (Kerala); WHO declared it as Health emergency of international concern 11th Feb, 2020- Name COVID-19 by WHO 11th March, 2020- WHO declared COVID- 19 as global pandemic
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Which of the following do not manifest on first day of life?
exp: Neonatal tetanus manifests on 8th day of life; thus referred as '8th day disease. ' Remaining all conditions given, can manifest on 1st day of life. Also remember, - Neonatal tetanus Elimination criteria: Rate < 0. 1 case / 1000 LB. Coverage TT > 90%. Attended deliveries > 75%.
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Risk of damage to fetus by maternal rubella is maximum if mother gets infected in
exp: The risk of congenital malformations following infections by teratogenic organisms is maximum in first trimester, so the best option is 6-12 weeks.
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: During the first week of infection, Dengue can be best detected by:
exp: Dengue: - Caused by Group-B Arbovirus - D1, D2, D3, D4 - Vector - Aedes aegypti - Reservoir - Man, Aedes - Incubation period - 3 to 10 days - Diagnosis: Clinically - Torniquet test - >= 10 spots - Dengue fever; >= 20 spots - Dengue hemorrhagic fever. Serologically - NS-1 Antigen Test comes positive even in 1st week. - Presentation: Dengue fever Dengue hemorrhagic fever Dengue shock syndrome - Backbone fever - Fever - Hemorrhagic features - Thrombocytopenia - Hemo-concentration - DHF +ve - Shock - Vaccine: DENGAVARIA, Strain: CYD - TDV; recommended in age groups 9-45yrs
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Which of the following is true about Endemic typhus?
exp: Endemic typhus Also known as: Flea-borne typhus, murine typhus Causative agent: Rickettsia typhi Vector: rat flea Reservoir: Rodents Weil felix reaction becomes +ve in: 2nd week Drug of choice: Tetracycline.
opd: Tetracycline is not useful for treatment
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: True about Trench fever are all except:-
exp: Trench fever: Aka 5 days fever, shin-bone fever, wolhynia fever, Quintana fever. Caused by Baonella quintana. Transmitted by pediculus corporis. Doxycycline is the treatment of choice. Also remember: 3- day fever, sand-fly fever. 7-day fever: leptospirosis.
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Which of the following dengue sequential serotypes infection are associated with maximum risk of dengue hemmorhagic fever?
exp: Studies in Thailand have revealed that the DENV-1/ DENV-2 sequence of infection was associated with a 500 fold risk of DHF compared with primary infection. For the DENV-3/DENV-2 sequence the risk was 150-fold, and a DENV-4/DENV-2 sequence had a 50-fold risk of DHF. There is no time-limit to sensitization after a primary infection. The 1997 Santiago de Cuba epidemic clearly demonstrated that with the introduction of DENV-2, DHF had occurred 16-20 years after the primary infection with DENV-1.
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Select false statement regarding Rabies infection Rabies is dead end infection in man Can be transmitted by aerosols Suturing is usually recommended on local wound Human Rabies immunoglobulin dose - 10 IU/kg Human bite can transmit Rabies infection
exp: Rabies is dead end infection in man. Can be transmitted by aerosols (Rabies infected bats). Suturing not recommended; if necessary, do 24-48 hours later. Cleansing: Flush and wash wound area with plenty of soap and running water for minimum 5-10 minutes. Human Rabies immunoglobin dose - 20 IU/kg. Human & rat bite don't transmit Rabies infection.
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Amplifier host in Japanese encephalitis is:
exp: Japanese encephalitis: Cause: Group-B Arbovirus. Vector: Culex triteniorhynchus. Birds are natural hosts: pond herons, cattle egrets, poultry & duck. Pigs are 'Amplifier hosts': pigs themselves do not manifest ove symptoms but circulate the virus. Cattle & buffaloes are 'mosquito attractants': infected but not the natural hosts of JE virus. Horses are only domestic animals which show signs of encephalitis. Man is an 'Incidental dead end host'. Man to man transmission is not seen 85% cases occur in children <15 years of age. I. P - 5-15 Days. Vaccines - Live strain: SA-14-14-2; Killed strain: Nakayama, Beijing P3.
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Vector of Crimean Congo Hemorrhagic fever:-
exp: Ixodid (hard) ticks, especially those of the genus, Hyalomma, are both a reservoir and a vector for the CCHF virus. Numerous wild and domestic animals, such as cattle, goats, sheep and hares, serve as amplifying hosts for the virus. Transmission to humans occurs through contact with infected ticks or animal blood. CCHF can be transmitted from one infected human to another by contact with infectious blood or body fluids. Documented spread of CCHF has also occurred in hospitals due to improper sterilization of medical equipment, reuse of injection needles, and contamination of medical supplies.
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: All are true regarding Lymphatic Filariasis except
exp: Discussing options one by one: Option -1 - True: Causative agent of lymphatic filariasis - Wuchereria bancrofti Option- 2 - False: Intermediate host in lymphatic filariasis is Mosquito; Definitive host is MAN. Option- 3 - True: Main vector in India - Culex quinquefasciatus Option- 4 - True: Most common epidemiological method for detection - thick film preparation. - Chemotherapy is done by - DEC (Diethylcarbamazine). - Also remember, to detect low-density microfilaraemia, Membrane filter concentration (MFC) method is the most sensitive one.
opc: Main vector in India - Culex quinquefasciatus
opd: Most common epidemiological method for detection - thick film preparation
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Which of the following is a Tick borne disease?
exp: Vectors of rickettsia disease:- Disease Vector Epidemic typhus Endemic typhus Scrub typhus Louse Flea Trombiculid mite Spotted fever GROUP Indian tick typhus RMSF Rickettsial pox Tick Tick Mite Others Q fever Trench fever Nil Louse
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Select the true statement regarding Tetanus
exp: Causative agent: Clostridium tetani (Gram + bacilli, anaerobic, drum stick appearance) Incubation period: 6-10 days No person to person transmission. Herd immunity does not protect individuals. Tetanus toxin: second most lethal toxin (Most lethal toxin is botulinum toxin). Lethal dose for 70 kg man: 0. 1kg India was declared maternal & neonatal tetanus eliminated in July 2016. Neonatal Tetanus is also known as 8th day disease.
opd: One dose TT gives Life long immunity
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Breteau Index is used for:
exp: Indices of surveillance of Yellow Fever: 1. Breteau index: No of containers showing breeding of aedes larvae / total no of house surveyed X 100. It should be <1% in town, seapos & in endemic areas to ensure freedom from yellow fever. 2. House index. 3. Container index.
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Rapid diagnosis of Rabies in a Rabid living dog is by?
exp: Flourescent Antibody Test: This is a highly reliable and the best single test currently available for the Rapid diagnosis of Rabies viral Antigen in Infected specimen. Corneal impression & Mouse inoculations are also used for diagnosis.
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Chikungunya is transmitted by
exp: Aedes aegypti primarily, also Culex and Mansonia transmit Chikungunya
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Which of the following diseases is not transmitted by mosquitoes
exp: Out of Six diseases ( Malaria, Japanese Encephalitis, Kala Azar, Filaria and Chikungunya Fever) under the NVBDCP, five are transmitted by different kinds of vector mosquitoes, while Kala Azar is transmitted by sand flies. Kala-azar (KA) or Visceral Leishmaniasis (VL) is caused by parasite Leishmania Donovani and transmitted by Phlebotomus argentipes (Sandy fly). Incubation period in KA varies from 10 days to > 2 years in general but from four months to one year in India. Disease found across all age groups. Males are more afflicted than females The geographical spread of the disease is limited to 54 districts in India.
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Kala-azar is found in all endemic areas, except:-
exp: Kala-Azar is endemic in the following 4 states of India: 1. Bihar 2. Jharkhand 3. West Bengal 4. Uttar Pradesh - This is because of the vector: Phlebotomus argentipes primarily found in these 4 states.
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Infections transmitted to man from veebrate animals are known as:
exp: - Anthropozoonoses: Infections transmitted from animals (zoo) to Man (anthro). They are Rabies Plague Anthrax Hydatid disease Trichinosis
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: A population of 100000 is under surveillance during a year. 100 cases were positive for malarial thick smear. 20 developed complications and 10 died among cases. What is the Annual parasite incidence?
exp: API= 1 per 1000 API ( annual parasitic incidence) 1. Best indicator of malaria control 2. ABER >= 10 % 3. API >= 2 - high risk area

question: Which of the following stage of life cycle of Plasmodium is seen in humans?
exp: Schizogony: Asexual cycle, endogenous phase, seen in Human. Human cycle of Plasmodium Hepatic phase Erythrocytic schizogony Gametogony Sporogony: Sexual cycle, exogenous phase, seen in mosquito.

exp: Kavach ELISA Indigenous ELISA Developed by isolating virus from indian individual. Will be used for surveillance purpose. Sero-Surveillance to be undeaken in 24000 people in 69 districts of the country. Surveillance at household level. It's just a survillence kit, diagnosis will still be done by -PCR test.

question: A man presents with fever and chills 2 weeks after a louse bite. There was a maculo-papular rash on the trunk, which spread peripherally. The cause of this infection can be:-
exp: Epidemic typhus is transmitted by louse. Scrub typhus and Rickettsial pox are transmitted by mites Endemic typhus is transmitted by rat flea.

question: Point mutation is seen in
exp: Antigenic shift may be due to genetic recombination, reassoment, rearrangement Sudden change in Antigenic variation occurs. Antigenic drift due to point mutation Antigenic change is Gradual over a Period of Time.
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Japanese Encephalitis is transmitted by
exp: Japanese Encephalitis is a viral disease caused by a Flavivirus It is transmitted by infective bites of female mosquitoes mainly primarily by Culex tritaeniorhynchus. Other vectors incriminated in transmission are Culex vishnui and Culex pseudo-vishnui group. However, some other mosquito species also play a role in transmission under specific conditions Mosquitoes breed in rice fields, shallow ditches and pools. Of these rice fields are impoant breeding place. JE virus is primarily zoonotic in its natural cycle and man is an accidental host. JE virus is neurotropic and arbovirus and primarily affects central nervous system
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections

question: Cyclops play an impoant role in the transmission of:
exp: Guinea Worm Causative agent: Dracunculus medinensis. Mode of transmission: consumption of water containing Cyclops harbouring infective stage of parasite - Hence option-3 is the answer. Type of disease: water-based disease. Type of biological transmission: Cyclo development transmission. India ceified for elimination of guineaworm: Feb 2000.
topic_name: VBDs, Arboviral & Viral Infections, Surface Infections
